articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: While shuttered at home, China exploits social media abroad
articles.description: China says its diplomats and government officials will fully exploit foreign social media platforms such as Facebook and Twitter that are blocked off to its own citizens
articles.content:
BEIJING -- 
China says its diplomats and government officials will fully exploit foreign social media platforms such as Facebook and Twitter that are blocked off to its own citizens.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: China says Human Rights Watch barred over protest support
articles.description: China says it barred the head of the internationally renowned organization Human Rights Watch from entering Hong Kong due to the group's support for the territory's ongoing protest movement
articles.content:

articles.author: BUSABA SIVASOMBOON Associated Press
articles.title: Thailand eases royal motorcade rules to unblock traffic
articles.description: Thailand's king has directed police to reduce the closure of roads during royal motorcades
articles.content:
BANGKOK -- 
Thailand's king has directed police to reduce the closure of roads during royal motorcades.

articles.author: Kelly Terez, Mark Osborne
articles.title: 'Start Here': Pelosi plans to send impeachment articles to Senate
articles.description: It's Monday, Jan. 13, 2020. Here's what you need to know to start your day.
articles.content:
It's Monday, Jan. 13, 2020. Let's start here.
1. Impeachment trial
House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is preparing to deliver the impeachment articles to the Senate within days and a trial could begin as early as this week.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Spain: New left-wing coalition Cabinet members take oaths
articles.description: Twenty-two Cabinet ministers have taken their oaths to join Spain's center to far left-wing coalition administration, a first in a country once dominated by two main parties taking turns in power
articles.content:
MADRID -- 
Twenty-two Cabinet ministers have taken their oaths to join Spain's center to far left-wing coalition administration, a first in a country once dominated by two main parties taking turns in power.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Alaska man rescued weeks after remote cabin burned down
articles.description: Alaska State Troopers have rescued a man who survived in a makeshift shelter after his remote cabin burned last month
articles.content:
ANCHORAGE, Alaska -- 
Weeks after an Alaska man's remote cabin burned down, he was rescued by Alaska State Troopers who found him by a makeshift shelter with an SOS signal stamped in the snow.

articles.author: DALATOU MAMANE Associated Press
articles.title: Niger says 89 soldiers killed in attack by extremists
articles.description: Niger's government has announced that the death toll from an attack by Islamic extremists on the military last week has risen to at least 89, making it the most deadly attack of its kind in years in the West African nation
articles.content:
